course_title: Advanced Therapy Skills: Working with Families and Groups

learning_outcomes.description: Compare and contrast the different approaches offered in family and group work , understand their application and critically evaluate clinical psychotherapy or art therapy family and group work literature.
identify the development of the frameworks, theoretical principles and application of therapy involving families and groups, recognising how it impacts on treatment planning and outcomes.
Develop and demonstrate your understanding of either group or family therapy approaches by applying this during your final assessment.
identify people and populations likely to benefit from group and or family interventions and be able to demonstrate a specific approach for a specific population.

assessments.task_description:
You are required to complete 10 visual journal entries throughout the semester. Each entry should include 1-2 images and be accompanied by approximately 300 words (+/- 10%).

Each journal entry is to be completed by the Monday after the tutorial, as response and analysis of the tutorial readings and discussion, and should consider the following:

1. Key aspects of the literature and/or class discussion that stood out to you

2. How the frameworks/interventions discussed resonate with you and your practice.

3. What the art work created conveys, and how it supports your learning? 

Criteria & Marking:

  1. Journal entries are original and show evidence that the reading and class discussion has been analysed and responded to in a thoughtful and reflective manner.
  2. The prompting journal questions have been considered and responded to appropriately.
  3. Art work is clearly presented and the quality of media, process of art making, and visual reflection is described.
  4. There are 10 journal entries that are on time, are within the word limit, are free of spelling and grammatical errors, and which demonstrate appropriate care with the task.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Assessments submitted after the due date without an approved extension will receive a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Family Art Therapy Intervention ART THERAPY
assessments.task_description:
Word count: 2000 +/- 10%

Task Description:

Discuss an art therapy intervention designed for a family, detailing the theoretical frameworks and the rationale for choosing this application for the specific client group.

You are required to:

  1. Identify and describe a population that could benefit from a family therapy intervention.
  2. Articulate the needs of this population.
  3. Explain how family art therapy could address these needs.
  4. Identify and describe family therapy strategies that may benefit this population.

Your assertions about the population and their needs must be supported by references to recent literature, personal investigation, and, if relevant, clinical or placement experience.

Criteria & Marking:

  1. You have identified an appropriate population who could benefit from a family therapy intervention. The population is described and their needs and challenges are articulated. 
  2. The reason family art therapy could be beneficial, including the choice of family strategies and intervention is articulated, and supported by literature.
  3. Essay is in an appropriate academic form and structure, is well written and free from grammatical and spelling errors. Referencing and citation uses standard format and the essay is 2000 words (+/- 10%).

assessments.late_submission: Assessments submitted after the due date without an approved extension will receive a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Group Intervention and discussion ART THERAPY
assessments.task_description:
Proposal Submission:

  1. Identify your co-facilitator and the chosen population.
  2. Email a proposal for your workshop to the Course Coordinator by Monday, October 6th.

Workshop Preparation and Facilitation:

  1. Prepare and co-facilitate a therapy group with fellow students participating in a role-play.
  2. Identify a population that could benefit from group therapy and develop a suitable intervention.
  3. Ensure the intervention is informed by literature on the suitability and effectiveness for the chosen population.
  4. Demonstrate a high level of knowledge about the art media and skill in managing the group process.
  5. The activity should last 60-90 minutes and be suitable for the available facilities. Manage your time effectively.

Feedback Session:

  1. Following the group, participate in a 20-minute feedback session.
  2. Explain the rationale for your chosen activities.
  3. Reflect on the co-facilitation experience.
  4. Receive feedback from your peers.

Criteria & Marking:

  1. Group therapy intervention is suitable and likely to be effective for the selected population
  2. You demonstrate a high level of knowledge of the art media and organisation skills in planning the intervention
  3. You demonstrate a high level of skill in managing group process, including processing of the art work and clear communication
  4. The activity is completed within the time frame and is suitable for the facilities and resources offered
  5. You demonstrate the ability to effectively co-facilitate a therapy group with a peer
  6. You are able to discuss the rationale for your work and critically reflect upon the process in a 20 minute feedback session.

assessments.assessment_title: Essay Comparing group and family therapies PSYCHOTHERAPY
assessments.task_description:
Write a 2,500-word essay examining the similarities and differences between Group Therapy and Family Therapy in mental health and psychotherapy practice. Address the following points:

  1. Compare and contrast the development of Group Therapy and Family Therapy.
  2. Discuss the different theoretical approaches underpinning each therapy.
  3. Evaluate the evidence for the effectiveness of each therapy.

Consider whether these therapies are fundamentally similar but applied to different populations, specifically unrelated versus related individuals.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Assessments submitted after the due date without an approved extension will receive a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Task Description:

Prepare and deliver a 20-minute oral presentation proposing a group therapy intervention relevant to your current professional context or area of interest.

Presentation Requirements:

Target Population

Identify and justify a specific population that would benefit from a group therapy approach.

Group Intervention/ Activities

Develop an appropriate group intervention tailored to the needs of the chosen population. Your proposal must be grounded in current literature, demonstrating an understanding of the therapeutic needs, strengths, and potential challenges associated with the group.

Evidence Base

Provide a clear rationale for your proposed group therapy model. Draw on contemporary research and relevant theoretical frameworks to justify the suitability and effectiveness of your intervention for the identified population.

Group Structure and Process

Explain the format and structure of your proposed group (e.g., open vs. closed, session frequency, facilitation style, therapeutic approach). Support your decisions with literature that outlines best practices in group facilitation and therapeutic outcomes.

Discussion Component

Following your presentation, you will participate in a 10-minute discussion facilitated by the Course Coordinator and fellow students. This is an opportunity to respond to questions, clarify your approach, and reflect on feedback.

Presentation Dates

Student presentations will be scheduled during the tutorial sessions on Thursday 9th and 16th October 2025. A schedule will be distributed in advance.

assessments.task_description:
10 Journal entries, completed weekly

Entries should explicitly engage with the assigned weekly tutorial readings, incorporating critical self-reflection to demonstrate how these insights inform your current understanding and influence your future professional or academic practice.

Students will be responsible for summarising the assigned material and facilitating a peer discussion during one of the scheduled tutorials throughout the semester.
